definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: It really is of no matter, but I fail to see why you should get so warm over a trifle.
sentences.chinese: 這只不過是個小事，但我不明白你爲何如此大動肝火。

sentences.english: She's got into a huff because my brother didn't remember her name.
sentences.chinese: 她因爲我的兄弟忘了她的名字而大動肝火。

sentences.english: Choose to pass the time doing something you enjoy rather than fuming.
sentences.chinese: 用做事來打發時光比大動肝火爲好。

sentences.english: Cool down ; there's no need to lose your temper over such a trivial matter.
sentences.chinese: 冷靜些，沒有必要爲如此區區小事而大動肝火。

sentences.english: The accident could bring her out in a temper.
sentences.chinese: 那事件會使她大動肝火。

sentences.english: The boss is up in arms about the company's poor sales record last month.
sentences.chinese: 老闆因上個月銷售業績不佳而大動肝火。
這種對比讓中國官員大動肝火。

sentences.english: Why should you fly into such a rage at a small thing like this?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼要爲這麼點的小事而如此地大動肝火呢？

sentences.english: "He is a nervous, bilious subject, " said Larrey;
sentences.chinese: “這是個神經質的，易動肝火的人，”拉雷說。

sentences.english: Dad is up in arms because you used the car without his permission.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸大動肝火，因爲你未經他同意而使用他的汽車。
